1.title: Ancient Mount Sokoria
1.description: The formation begins with an ancient volcanic edifice known as Mount Sokoria. Geological traces and remaining volcanic materials indicate its past activity.

2.title: A Major Eruption Creates the Sokoria Caldera
2.description: A powerful explosive eruption destroyed Mount Sokoria’s summit and produced a wide caldera, marking the first major restructuring of the landscape.

3.title: Formation of Mount Kelibara (Old Kelimutu)
3.description: Within the caldera, new volcanic activity built a younger cone called Mount Kelibara — often regarded as the ‘older Kelimutu’.

4.title: An Eruption Forms the Child of Kelibara
4.description: Subsequent eruptions gave rise to a smaller volcanic cone known as the Child of Kelibara, located where Tiwu Ata Bupu stands today.

5.title: Repeated Eruptions Over Hundreds of Years
5.description: The Child of Kelibara experienced multiple eruptions over several centuries, gradually reshaping the summit region and weakening the older structures.

6.title: Final Major Eruptions Create Mount Kelimutu
6.description: Explosive events — including the last recorded eruption in 1968 — completed the formation of Mount Kelimutu and sculpted the three summit craters.

7.title: Present-Day Kelimutu Crater Lakes
7.description: After volcanic activity subsided, rainwater and hydrothermal fluids filled the craters, forming the three iconic crater lakes whose colors continue to change due to ongoing geochemical processes.

1.title: Bhuria – The Veiled Forest
1.description: Long ago, the mountain was cloaked in misty Bhuria, a sacred forest where ancestral spirits 'Embu Nosi' and unseen entities 'Nitu' roamed.

2.title: The Rule of Konde Ratu
2.description: People lived under Konde Ratu’s rule, with Ata Bupu, protector of the innocent, and Ata Polo, a sinister sorcerer preying on the weak.

3.title: The Orphans Seek Refuge
3.description: Two orphaned youths, 'Ana Kalo', sought shelter in Ata Bupu’s lands, and he granted them sanctuary from harm.

4.title: The Shadow of Ata Polo
4.description: Ata Polo sought the youths, but Ata Bupu stood firm: 'Let these children reach their days,' he said, defending them.

5.title: The Youths Mature
5.description: The orphans grew into Ko'o Fai and Nuwa Muri. Ata Polo demanded them, but Ata Bupu refused to yield.

6.title: Vanishing into the Earth
6.description: To escape Ata Polo, Ata Bupu and the youths vanished into the earth. Ata Polo pursued, but all were swallowed by the land.

7.title: The Birth of the Tri-Lakes
7.description: Where they disappeared, the land ruptured forming the tri-colored lakes: Ata Bupu’s green, the youths’ turquoise, and Ata Polo’s crimson brown.
